definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Biomes are much larger than ecosystems.
sentences.chinese: 生物群落比生态系统范围要大。

sentences.english: Lets start by defining a biome.
sentences.chinese: 首先我们先解释一下生物群落。

sentences.english: When we think of swarms, we are familiar with the first thing that comes to mind is a swarm of bees.
sentences.chinese: 我们所熟知的生物群，首先就会想到蜂拥而上的蜜蜂。

sentences.english: Species and biological communities have difficulty adapting to change.
sentences.chinese: 物种和生物群落难以适应变化。

sentences.english: There are lots of biomes on the earth that can be seen.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道在地球上有许多的生物群系。

sentences.english: Discusses the plants, animals, and characteristics of the grassland biome.
sentences.chinese: 论述了植物，动物和草原生物群落的特点。

sentences.english: Macroevolution studies how taxonomic groups above the level of species change.
sentences.chinese: 巨演化研究物种以上层次的生物群变化。

definition: pre-Cambrian, geological period before c. 540m years ago
Paleozoic, geological era 545-250m years ago, covering Cambrian 寒武紀|寒武纪, Ordovician 奧陶紀|奥陶纪, Silurian 志留紀|志留纪, Devonian 泥盆紀|泥盆纪, Carboniferous 石炭紀|石炭纪, Permian 二疊紀|二叠纪
fourth period/quaternary (geological period covering the recent ice ages over the last 180,000 years)
ancient hominid species such as Homo erectus, Neanderthal man etc
